abstract: The S.E.C. said Perry Corp., a hedge fund firm, has agreed to pay $150,000 to settle civil charges that Perry violated laws by failing to disclose its stake in Mylan soon enough during a 2004 takeover feud.
snippet: The S.E.C. said Perry Corp., a hedge fund firm, has agreed to pay $150,000 to settle civil charges that Perry violated laws by failing to disclose its stake in Mylan soon enough during a 2004 takeover feud.
lead_paragraph: Way back in 2004, DealBook got kind of worked up about how a hedge fund was trying to influence the shareholder vote in a major takeover by acquiring a voting stake with no economic risk. DealBook’s column in The New York Times said the fund, Perry Corporation, seemed to be “gaming the system to a new extreme”; Carl C. Icahn was even more blunt, saying it was “rigging an election, plain and simple.”

headline.main: Perry to Pay $150,000 in S.E.C. Settlement
